subject: Climate & Environment
title: Pollinators and Food Chains
description: A short lesson to help you apply Pollinators and Food Chains.

hook.text: One out of every three bites of food you eat was made possible by a pollinator.

buildup.text: Bees, butterflies, bats, and birds carry pollen between flowers, enabling fruit and seed.

discovery.text: Without pollinators, coffee, chocolate, almonds, and most fruits would disappear.

twist.text: Colony collapse disorder wiped out 30-40% of US honeybee colonies in a single year.

climax.text: Neonicotinoid pesticides disorient bees â€” they can't find their way home.

punchline.text: No bees, no fruit. It really is that simple.

quiz.question: What fraction of food depends on pollinators?
